SuperDuperDB DocumentationÔÉÅ

class collection.Collection(*args, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

SuperDuperDB collection type, subclassing pymongo.collection.Collection. Key methods are:

Creating objects:

  • create_converter

  • create_imputation

  • create_loss

  • create_metric

  • create_model

  • create_neighbourhood

  • create_semantic_index

  • create_splitter

Deleting objects:

  • delete_converter

  • delete_imputation

  • delete_loss

  • delete_metric

  • delete_model

  • delete_neighbourhood

  • delete_semantic_index

  • delete_splitter

Accessing data:

  • find_one

  • find

Inserting and updating data: - insert_many - insert_one - replace_one - update_one - update_many

Viewing meta-data

  • list_models

  • list_semantic_indexes

  • list_imputations

  • list_converters

  • list_losss

  • list_metrics

Watching jobs

  • watch_job

Key properties:

  • converters (dictionary of converters)

  • hash_set (in memory vectors for neighbourhood search)

  • losses (dictionary of losses)

  • measures (dictionary of measures)

  • metrics (dictionary of metrics)

  • models (dictionary of models)

  • remote (whether the client sends requests in thread or to a server)

  • splitters (dictionary of splitters)

Get / create a Mongo collection.

Raises TypeError if name is not an instance of basestring (str in python 3). Raises InvalidName if name is not a valid collection name. Any additional keyword arguments will be used as options passed to the create command. See create_collection() for valid options.

If create is True, collation is specified, or any additional keyword arguments are present, a create command will be sent, using session if specified. Otherwise, a create command will not be sent and the collection will be created implicitly on first use. The optional session argument is only used for the create command, it is not associated with the collection afterward.

Parameters

  • database: the database to get a collection from

  • name: the name of the collection to get

  • create (optional): if True, force collection creation even without options being set

  • codec_options (optional): An instance of CodecOptions. If None (the default) database.codec_options is used.

  • read_preference (optional): The read preference to use. If None (the default) database.read_preference is used.

  • write_concern (optional): An instance of WriteConcern. If None (the default) database.write_concern is used.

  • read_concern (optional): An instance of ReadConcern. If None (the default) database.read_concern is used.

  • collation (optional): An instance of Collation. If a collation is provided, it will be passed to the create collection command.

  • session (optional): a ClientSession that is used with the create collection command

  • **kwargs (optional): additional keyword arguments will be passed as options for the create collection command

Changed in version 4.2: Added the clusteredIndex and encryptedFields parameters.

Changed in version 4.0: Removed the reindex, map_reduce, inline_map_reduce, parallel_scan, initialize_unordered_bulk_op, initialize_ordered_bulk_op, group, count, insert, save, update, remove, find_and_modify, and ensure_index methods. See the pymongo4-migration-guide.

Changed in version 3.6: Added session parameter.

Changed in version 3.4: Support the collation option.

Changed in version 3.2: Added the read_concern option.

Changed in version 3.0: Added the codec_options, read_preference, and write_concern options. Removed the uuid_subtype attribute. Collection no longer returns an instance of Collection for attribute names with leading underscores. You must use dict-style lookups instead::

collection[‚Äò__my_collection__‚Äô]

Not:

collection.__my_collection__

See also

The MongoDB documentation on collections.

  • object ‚Äì Python object

  • object ‚Äì Python object

Parameters

  • name ‚Äì name of metric

  • object ‚Äì Python object

create_model(name, object=None, filter=None, converter=None, active=True, dependencies=None, key='_base', verbose=False, semantic_index=False, process_docs=True, loader_kwargs=None, max_chunk_size=5000, features=None, measure=None, requires=None)ÔÉÅ

Create a model registered in the collection directly from a python session. The added model will then watch incoming records and add outputs computed on those records into the ‚Äú_outputs‚Äù of the records. The model is then stored inside MongoDB and can be accessed using the SddbClient.

Parameters

  • name ‚Äì name of model

  • object ‚Äì if specified the model object (pickle-able) else None if model already exists

  • filter ‚Äì filter specifying which documents model acts on

  • converter ‚Äì converter for converting model outputs back and forth from bytes

  • active ‚Äì toggle to False if model should not actively process incoming data

  • dependencies ‚Äì list of models on which model‚Äôs inputs depend (executed prior)

  • key ‚Äì key in records on which model acts (default whole record ‚Äú_base‚Äù)

  • verbose ‚Äì toggle to True if processing on data is verbose

  • semantic_index ‚Äì toggle to True

  • process_docs ‚Äì toggle to False if documents not to be processed by models

  • loader_kwargs ‚Äì kwargs to be passed to dataloader for model in processing

  • max_chunk_size ‚Äì maximum chunk size of documents to be held in memory simultaneously

  • features ‚Äì dictionary of features to be substituted from model outputs to record

create_semantic_index(name, models, measure, metrics=None, loss=None, splitter=None, **trainer_kwargs)ÔÉÅ
Parameters

  • name ‚Äì Name of index

  • models ‚Äì List of existing models, or parameters to Collection.create_model

  • measure ‚Äì Measure name, or parameters to Collection.create_measure

  • metrics ‚Äì List of existing metrics, or parameters to Collection.create_metric

  • loss ‚Äì Loss name, or parameters to Collection.create_loss

  • splitter ‚Äì Splitter name, or parameters to Collection.create_splitter

  • trainer_kwargs ‚Äì Keyword arguments to be passed to training.train_tools.RepresentationTrainer

Returns

List of job identifiers if self.remote

find(filter=None, *args, similar_first=False, raw=False, features=None, download=False, similar_join=None, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Behaves like MongoDB find with exception of ‚Äú$like‚Äù operator.

Parameters

  • filter ‚Äì filter dictionary

  • args ‚Äì args passed to super()

  • similar_first ‚Äì toggle to True to first find similar things, and then apply filter to these things

  • raw ‚Äì toggle to True to not convert bytes to Python objects but return raw bytes

  • features ‚Äì dictionary of model outputs to replace for dictionary elements

  • download ‚Äì toggle to True in case query has downloadable ‚Äú_content‚Äù components

  • similar_join ‚Äì replace ids by documents

  • kwargs ‚Äì kwargs to be passed to super()

find_one(*args, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Behaves like MongoDB find_one with exception of ‚Äú$like‚Äù operator. See Collection.find for more details.

Parameters

  • args ‚Äì args passed to super()

  • kwargs ‚Äì kwargs to be passed to super()

replace_one(filter, replacement, *args, refresh=True, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Replace a document in the database. The outputs of models will be refreshed for this document.

Parameters

  • filter ‚Äì MongoDB like filter

  • replacement ‚Äì Replacement document

  • args ‚Äì args to be passed to super()

  • refresh ‚Äì Toggle to False to not process document again with models.

  • kwargs ‚Äì kwargs to be passed to super()

unset_hash_set()ÔÉÅ

Drop the hash_set currently in-use.

update_many(filter, *args, refresh=True, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Update the collection at the documents specified by the filter.

Parameters

  • filter ‚Äì Filter dictionary selecting documents to be updated

  • args ‚Äì Arguments to be passed to super()

  • refresh ‚Äì Toggle to False to stop models being applied to updated documents

  • kwargs ‚Äì Keyword arguments to be passed to super()

Returns

result or (result, job_ids) depending on self.remote

update_one(filter, *args, refresh=True, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Update a single document specified by the filter.

Parameters

  • filter ‚Äì Filter dictionary selecting documents to be updated

  • args ‚Äì Arguments to be passed to super()

  • refresh ‚Äì Toggle to False to stop models being applied to updated documents

  • kwargs ‚Äì Keyword arguments to be passed to super()

Returns

result or (result, job_ids) depending on self.remote
